channel.title: math.GM updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GM updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: A symmetry approach to number tricks
item.description: arXiv:2509.04487v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We generalize the classical "1089-number trick", which states that a certain combination of addition, subtraction and swapping the digits of a three-digit number will always output 1089. More precisely, we show that any pair of zero divisors $fg=0$ in the group ring ${\mathbb Z}[\Sigma_n]$ on the n-th symmetric group gives rise to a partition of the set of n-digit numbers into subsets $U_{\mathbf e}$ defined by linear inequalities, such that the zero divisors act constantly on each $U_{\mathbf e}$ and hence define a number trick.
item.dc:creator: H{\aa}kon Kolderup
